title: AFK DUES ?? after winning a game
body: umm i had a bad internet connection for the first 10 minutes of the game and then i reconnected then we carried the game and we won it..... and then i get a afk notcie and i really dont want to waste 20 minutes just to play a game that can take 10 or even 40 minutes to play ... and i had a disconnection and my team didnt remake so i dont get it ...

replies.body:
The [Leaverbuster System](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) works independently of the /Remake system, although their penalties are similar. Regardless of the reason for disconnection, it negatively impacts everyone in the match. This is why all disconnections are treated equally and why penalties cannot be modified in any way.

Connection issues are often the result of incompatible network settings, so I recommend working through our [connection troubleshooting guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Let me know if those steps resulted in any change.

Just out of morbid curiosity in the thought process. As a person who's had one bugsplat induced leaver penalty, and one client crash queue dodge in the entire time I've played, so not looking to get around anything.

What's the incentive to rejoin? If Disconnecting and getting back in has the same penalty as DCing and staying DCed, then why would a person ever want to rejoin and try to help win? Especially since they get no rewards, and still lose LP if they do manage to comeback for a win.

Why wouldn't a person not just play a different game, until the league one ends, then just eat the penalty they will get no matter what they did?

Shouldn't rejoining and helping improve the experience that has been negatively impacted be incentivized through potential for no penalty should you rejoin and win?
